activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles G. Bloede

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 10:25 AM: Defendant Charles G. Bloede in court. Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Charles G. Bloede. Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. DE stands mute to the charges. The Court enters NG Pleas on behalf of the DE. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:35 am.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 09:35 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 9:27 AM Defendant Charles G. Bloede appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for SPD services but an attorney has not yet been appointed. Statement by DA Leusink. The Court inquires about the bond requested and ordered. Recitation of the bond hearing by DA Leusink. DA Leusink does not oppose a bond reduction in this matter. The Court modifies the bond to a $10,000 Sig Bond. The Court directs the defendant to contact SPD regarding the status of counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case called @ 1:03 PM Defendant Charles G. Bloede in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. DE advises he has contacted SPD and is eligible for services. The Court will adjourn the IA to allow time for SPD to appoint an attorney. AIA scheduled - NOH given.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 09:20 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Case called @ 1:11 PM Defendant Charles G. Bloede appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by phone for Charles G. Bloede. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE's eligibility for SPD services not yet determined. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders: $3000 cash bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial appearance on August 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
